I'm glad you're interested in learning more about film criticism! As someone who's attended several film festivals, you know how important critics' opinions can be in shaping the buzz around a film. I think film critics play a crucial role in helping audiences discover new films and filmmakers, and their reviews can have a significant impact on a film's box office performance.

Regarding your question, I think film critics can be both influential and intimidating. On one hand, they can help bring attention to underseen films and emerging talent, which is essential for the industry's growth. On the other hand, their opinions can be incredibly subjective, and a negative review from a prominent critic can be devastating for a film's chances.

As for favorite film critics or publications, I'm a big fan of RogerEbert.com, The A.V. Club, and The Film Comment. I appreciate their in-depth analysis and thoughtful critiques, which often go beyond just a simple thumbs-up or thumbs-down.
